intro: Swertia brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed swertia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while the flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Swertia brevipedicellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
